section.section: The Secretary shall continually conduct studies on the needs of units of the Executive Branch of the State government and of private entities to which the State appropriates money.

To obtain the information that the Secretary wants in estimating the needs of the unit or entity, the Secretary may:
question any officer or employee of the unit or entity; and
examine the records of the unit or entity.

The studies of the units of the Executive Branch of the State government shall include:
program analyses; and
careful consideration of the administration, organization, functions, and duties of the units, to identify duplication or overlap.
The Secretary shall send a copy of each report under this subsection, subject to § 2-1246 of the State Government Article, to the Executive Director of the Department of Legislative Services.
